required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Gene Therapy for Chinese Hemophilia B
clinical_study.official_title: Gene Therapy for Chinese Hemophilia B With Adeno-associated Virus (AAV) Vector

lead_sponsor.agency: Institute of Hematology & Blood Diseases Hospital

collaborator.agency: East China University of Science and Technology

clinical_study.source: Institute of Hematology & Blood Diseases Hospital

brief_summary.textblock: GT2019001 is a Phase 1, open- label, non- randomized, uncontrolled, single dose pilot study to evaluate the safety, tolerability and kinetics of a single intravenous infusion of BBM-H901 in hemophilia B subjects with ≤2IU/dl residual FIX levels. BBM-H901 is an adeno-associated viral (AAV) vector designed to drive expression of the human factor IX (hFIX) transgene and raise circulating levels of endogenous FIX.

detailed_description.textblock: GT2019001 is a Phase 1, open- label, non- randomized, uncontrolled, single dose pilot study to evaluate the safety, tolerability and kinetics of a single intravenous infusion of BBM-H901 in hemophilia B subjects with ≤2IU/dl residual FIX levels. Three subjects will be enrolled and administered with single infusion of BBM-H901, an AAV at one dose level of 5x1012 vg/Kg.Subjects will provide informed consent and then undergo screening assessments up to 4-8weeks prior administration of BBM-H901. All subjects will undergo 52(+- 2) weeks safety observation and will be encouraged to enroll in an extension study to evaluate long- term safety of BBM-H901 for a total 5 years.The first subject will be dosed at 5x1012 vg/Kg and undergo 2 months safety observation of which the data will undergo review by an independent safety committee. The dosing to the second subject will not be performed until acquiring the approve from independent safety committee.

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence of treatment- related adverse events
primary_outcome.time_frame: Infusion to the end of study, average 1 year.
primary_outcome.description: Number of patients experiencing treatment-related adverse events. Including inhibitor development.

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline alanine aminotransferase ans aspartate amino transferase
primary_outcome.time_frame: At multiple timepoints from pre-dose through up to 1 years post-dose
primary_outcome.description: liver function tests include ALT, AST.

primary_outcome.time_frame: from screening through up to 1 years
primary_outcome.description: Immune response against AAV capsid will be evaluated by measurement of the total antibody and neutralizing antibody against AAV capsid protein in plasma samples collected at multiple timepoints after dosing up to 1 year.

secondary_outcome.measure: Vector- derived FIX:C and FIX antigen levels.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At multiple timepoints from pre-dose through up to 1 years post-dose
secondary_outcome.description: Vector- derived FIX:C and FIX antigen levels will be measured after dosing.

other_outcome.time_frame: From date of infusion until the date of 3 consecutive documented negative results, assessed up to 1 year
other_outcome.description: Serum and semen will be collected to assess clearance of vector genomes

other_outcome.measure: annualized bleeding rate changes from baseline
other_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 1 year
other_outcome.description: annualized bleeding rate changes from baseline

arm_group.description: Subjects will be dosed with single dose of BBM-H901 at 5x10·12 vg/kg via intravenous infusion.

intervention.intervention_name: Single dose intravenous injection of BBM-H901
intervention.description: Single dose intravenous infusion of BBM-H901, an adeno-associated viral (AAV) vector designed to drive expression of the human factor IX (hFIX) transgene in liver. The dose of BBM-H901 will be 5x10'12 vg/Kg.

overall_official.affiliation: Institute of Hematology & Blood Diseases Hospital

facility.name: Institute of Hematology & Blood Diseases Hospital

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Institute of Hematology & Blood Diseases Hospital
